required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Tachosil® for Lymph Sealing During Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Tachosil® for Lymph Sealing During Surgery. A Non-Interventional Study

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Paul-Ehrlich-Institut,Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to describe effectiveness and reliability of TachoSil® in lymph sealing after lymphadenectomy.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this non-interventional study (NIS) is to collect further knowledge on the routine use of TachoSil ® in lymph node surgery where its sealing property helps to reduce the rate of postoperative complications, especially of seroma formation. Some data are already available from gynecology, urology and thoracic surgery.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of post-operative seroma formation over time as determined at hospital discharge
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 30 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of TachoSil® by the surgeon with respect to handling, utility and satisfaction in the operation, documented using 10 point Numerical Rating Scales
Usage, duration and volume of drainage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Peri- and post-surgery until hospital discharge
Date of surgery until hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Length of stay includes time spent in the intensive care unit (ICU) and normal hospital station.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacoeconomic evaluation as assessed by the surgeon at hospital discharge based on savings of OP- time (minutes), shortening of hospital stay (days), reduction of drainage time (days) and drainage volume (ml)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 30 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with intra- and post-operative complications and adverse events

arm_group.description: Participants who had lymph node resection.

intervention.description: TachoSil® is a collagen sponge that is coated with the active substances human fibrinogen and human thrombin and that supports hemostasis and sealing of surgical wound.

study_pop.textblock: Stationary patients in whom a lymph node resection is planned to be performed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stationary patients undergoing lymph node resection.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications, such as hypersensitivity to the active pharmaceutical ingredient or to another ingredient.

overall_official.affiliation: Takeda Pharma Vertrieb GmbH & Co. KG
